DataElement.preferredName: TNM Staging System Assessment Timepoint Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of TNM staging completed based on their occurrence at a point in time.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Questionnaire Domain TNM Staging System Assessment Timepoint
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredDefinition: A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

Concepts.definition: A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Staging that is performed to determine the extent of cancer that has reoccurred following treatment or how the cancer responded to treatment.

Concepts.definition: Staging that is performed to determine the extent of cancer that has reoccurred following treatment or how the cancer responded to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. : Enrollment; to insert, register, or enter in a list, catalog, or roll. (Merriam-Webster Online)

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Performing exams and tests to learn the extent of the cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. It is important to know the stage of the disease in order to plan the best treatment.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
